Posts.Content: Dec 30, 2008 09:45PM Mabledw wrote: Thanks everyone for your suggestions.  I had 1 B12 shot, but couldn't tell any difference.   I do take a B Complex supplement.  No pain meds as I really don't have pain, just discomfort from the itchys.  I am 70 and up until July I am was very active.  Working in my garden,(I did heavy garden work too, like planting bushes and trees) walking 30 minutes.  I also did exercises indoors that involved weights but haven't done anything there for 3-4 weeks because of the severe fatigue.  I see my oncologist tomorrow, hopefully he can help me, or at least help me understand more of what's going on.  I have wanted to start yoga but don't even have the energy to think of it. I use to knit but haven't even had the strength to do that.  Thanks again and you are in my prayers and hope I am in yours.  Mable
Posts.Title: Tamoxifen Mabledw Mabledw

Posts.Content: Jan 2, 2009 09:59AM Mabledw wrote: My first harmonal was Femara and it really hurt me.  I felt like I had been run over by a truck- every muscle joint and bone ached.  I was put on Faslodex and was on it 13 months.  Seemed to be working until 8 months and then my markers started up, in June I had my first PET/CT scan and no tumors.  Finally at my October appointment my markers had gone up significantly and he ordered another PET/CT scan - still no tumors.  He said the Faslodex was not working so put me on Tamoxifin 250 mg.  By the time I started taking it I was already feeling fatigue.  Since I started taking it I have continued to go down hill.  Fatigue, nausea, itchy (but no rash).  Then when I was in last Wednesday he said he was sure it was in my GI system and that the itch was coming from the GI. Anyway, I am still searching and have more questions to ask him, thanks to you guys.  My son wants me to check with the Huntsman center.  He is a friend of that family and keeps up on alot of things.  I will keep you informed.   Mable.
Posts.Title: Tamoxifen Mabledw Mabledw

Posts.Content: Dec 31, 2008 07:06PM Mabledw wrote: Hi, thanks for your suggestions.  I really have had lots of faith in my oncologist.  He is considered the best in our area.  St Patricks Cancer Center is the best in our area.  The closest one that I could get a 2nd opinion is Salt Lake Huntsman Center or Seattle.  They are 500 & 750 miles away.  When he was telling me he said he had seen this in the lining of the stomach with stomach cancer.  Having breast cancer go to the gall bladder is very rare.  My surgeon, when he found out, looked it up and he said only 4% of all breast cancer recurrance ever goes to the gall bladder.  I have tried research on it and there is nothing.  In my gall bladder the path report said that it was in the lining of the gall bladder.  I felt I understood his explanation and it makes sense to me.  I am not good at explaining things. I have a copy of my original bc mastectomy, it says, "residual tumor mass, reveal an infilterating ductal carcinoma.  The tumor is characterized by infiltrating tubules and small nests and cords of tumor cells........   Maybe you have resources that you can investigate this more.  My knowledge of where to look is pretty limited to this site and Mayo, and google.  I may have just missed something too.  Thanks again.  Mable
Posts.Title: Tamoxifen Mabledw Mabledw

Posts.Content: Mabledw wrote: I need help!!!  Tomorrow I see my oncologist.  I called Monday and got in earlier than scheduled.  I am having so many problems.  I am nauseated, weak, yucky, and I have itches (not all the time) sometimes the itches feel more like bee stings or broken veins.  I have tried to refrain from scratching as I know this can cause bigger problems, but I have a couple spots where I have actually bruised myself.   I was on Faslodex for 13 months, during the last 6 months my markers went up significently.  I had 2 PET/CT scans - one in June and one in Nov. nothing showed up in either one.  Since July I have continued to feel week and fatigue.  I have gone to my Primary and had tests done - I did have low potassium, chloride & sodium.  I was already on 1 40 mq of potassium as I had been low before (lots of leg cramps, etc).  I have continued to feel fatigue, can hardly fix a meal or do a load of clothes.  I spend alot of time in the recliner. I am a very positive person and have never felt depressed.  In October I was put on tamoxifen.  December has been terrible.  I can hardly get anything done.  I did go to my son's for Christmas, 500 miles away.  My husband drove and we spent one night at our daughters to break up the time on the road.  I got to go to my granddaugter's performance in Ballet West's the Nutcracker.  It took 3 days to recover.    My oncologist says if the tamoxifen doesn't work his next step will be chemo.  Can the cancer cause the fatigue?  I thought cancer would go undetected without tests.  Any suggestions on questions I need to ask?  HELP,  Mable Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Tamoxifen Mabledw Mabledw

Posts.Content: Dec 31, 2008 02:16PM Mabledw wrote: Happy New Year to all of you!!!   I just got home from seeing my onc.  I told him all my complaints and he said "Well what do you think it is?"  I told him I did not know and that I had tried everything I knew to get rid of my symptoms.  He said "Well I think it is your cancer".  He explained it this way.  My breast cancer came back in my gall bladder, there were no tumors.  It was also in my marrow and bones.  No tumors.  He thinks it has  invadid my gi system.  He said its what they call infilterated "no tumors" and that is why nothing shows up in the PET/CT scans.  It can be all through my stomache lining or my intestines, etc.  So today we took blood tests including a new Markers test.  I will go to see him next Wednesday at 9:45.  He is thinking that if they are up he will start me on chemo.   So now what???  Those of you who have had chemo, what can I expect?  I just hate to tell my kids, they are so sensitive to my problems.  I have such a bunch of wonderfull kids (4 daughters, 1 son).  18 grandchildren, 2 great grands and 2 grandson's in law.  When we get together we have the best time.   Pray for me this week.  I appreciate any comments and especially about the chemo. Mable
Posts.Title: Tamoxifen Mabledw Mabledw

Posts.Content: Jun 12, 2008 07:26PM Mabledw wrote: Its been awhile- I had been waiting for today's Onc visit.  My April & May Marker tests have gone up.  I don't have results of today's.  My Onc thinks the Faslodex has stopped working and has ordered a PET/CT scan on Friday June 20th.  Then the 24th I meet with him to get the results.  He warned me that he may have to do CHEMO.  My mets have been to the gall bladder, bone marrow and bones.  DX Dec 2006.  Femara was rejected by my body and now Faslodex not working. I have had 2 full body bone scans, the last one in Oct and it didn't show any cancer except in my lower back.  I have had an MRI (Dec 06) on my head for brain cancer and it was clear. I had an MRI of my lower back in Oct also.  Had a CT scan of my adominal area in Dec as I had lots of problems with diahrea. They gave me phamplets on PET to read and really talked to me about the procedure, etc.  My thing is that I haven't any pain, I do have a funny sensation in my left chest near the shoulder, my blood pressure has gone up and I have been experiencing some dizziness.  I told him all this.  I am so mad as I was just feeling better again. I just don't know what to expect so am scared.  Please remember me in prayers.  Thanks Mable.
Posts.Title: PET Scan vs, Bone Scan JoyRebecca nuclear1

Posts.Content: Oct 24, 2007 04:33PM Mabledw wrote: Hi, I saw a pain management specialist Tuesday.  I am scheduled for shots in the 3/4 - 4/5 lumbar on Friday.  The Specialist said I had   herniated discs that are swelling into a hole in the vertbrea where the nerve goes through, also, I have some arthritis on the other side that makes the hole smaller too.  He says relief can come in 1-7 days and if it doesn't they do another set of shots, up to 3 sets. He said it is a steriod.  If this doesn't work, I will ask him about the facet injections.  I sure am tired of the pain and the pain medicine is almost intolerable for me.  I am just spaced and feel like I have the flue. I have tried several and don't want to do it again.  So I sit with Ice packs and suffer. This morning I feel almost human since I got rid of the effects of the pain meds and made it to the computer for a bit.  Thanks for your advice and comments.  Greatly appreciated.  Mable.
Posts.Title: Bone mets nursecal awjkej

Posts.Content: Mabledw wrote: Hi, its been awhile since I have been on again.  I have been on taxotere since Jan 7th.  Good news is that makers went down 110 points after 4th treatment.  yea!!!.  However, yesterday I got bad news.  Mets have gone to my liver.  I had been suffering with seeping nose bleeding for over 4 weeks.  Been to an otorologynist a couple times.  He said something must be down in my platelets or something.  Platelets have been a little down but nothing bad.  He put sergical cloth to patch the bad parts and had me keep cotton balls in my nose for a week.  It really helped, but 3 days later the bleeding started again.  In the mean time when my oncologist saw the cotton balls in my nose he decided he had better step up the blood tests.  Sent 12 vials to mayo clinic.  They came back that my cancer is in my liver and it is not creating the glue that holds the clots together.  He says it is serious, but the taxotere can work if the markers keep going down.  My question is what if the taxotere stops working, what then.  I know some of you have had mets to liver?  Any help.  Need lots of prayers.  Mable   I had mastocetomy of right breast 1996. no lymph nodes invloved.  Ductal carcinoma estrogen positive.   Cancer free 10 years.  Came back in 2006 in my gall bladder, bones and marrow.   Harmon therapy for  2 years and it stopped working.  My ductal carcinoma has been acting like lymphocytic carcinoma in that it does not produce any tumors.  My oncologist says my cancer is very sneaky. It has been in my GI system and now the liver. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Mets to liver - now what Mabledw heatherpalmerton

Posts.Content: Mabledw wrote: My harmone therapy stopped working all together.  My markers went up 100 points from Nov. 7th to Dec. 30th.  My symptoms continued to get worse and they definately believe it is in my GI system and even though I had Ductal carcinoma it is acting like lobular.  Undetected by PET/CT scan or untrasound.  My fatigue has been so bad and I have been nauseated and sickly, gradually getting worse since mid December.  Wednesday they started me on Taxotere once a week until it works.  I had an anti-nausea drug before the chemo.  Other than feeling like my body was lead I haven't had any other side effects so far.  Tuesday I go in for a port catheter so they won't have to poke my arm every week for labs and IV.  Last night I slept 11 hours and today I do look and feel some better.  Still very tired.  I am thankful to all of you who write in and explain your treatments and side effects.  It has been so helpful and enlightening.  He said in about 2 months I should start feeling better.  We hope to get this in remission and that it will stay. Have a great day.  Mable.  Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Markers up - Taxotere treatment. Mabledw luvtotravel

Posts.Content: Jan 20, 2009 07:37PM Mabledw wrote: Well this past week hasn't been good.  On top of the indigestion I ran a fever.  Was at the emergency room Friday night for 3 hours.  I dehydrated.  They gave me a bunch of stuff IV to help with the nausea and indigestion then a big jug of fluids and an oral dose of more stuff to coat my stomache.  Couldn't find any reason for the fever, however Saturday I started having indications of a sinus infection.  My fever ran until last night.  I did have some cipro here at  home so started taking it.  We'll see what the Onc says tomorrow.  After this week, I am not looking forward to my Chemo treatment tomorrow.  Does Chemo treatments cause fevers - my instruction sheet says if it is 101 or higher, to call the onc. Seeking lots of prayers.  Mable.
Posts.Title: Markers up - Taxotere treatment. Mabledw luvtotravel

Posts.Content: Jan 24, 2009 08:20PM Mabledw wrote: Third treatment Wednesday.  Onc gave me sleeping pills to take that night and Thursday as the Anti-nausea really wires me up.  It really made a difference to get better sleep.  My hair started falling out Thurs.  My head has been so sore so Fri I had it buzzed.  It made such a difference - no pain anymore and last night I really had another good nights sleep.  My fever went away Monday evening, but it returned yesterday.  LuAnn I'm with you and think it must be the Chemo too.  I'm just hoping I can drink enough water - it is so bitter.  I try to force myself.  Alot of my food is very bitter too.  I think I'm going to make it through this though.   Still asking for your prayers and thanks for the comments.  Mable.
Posts.Title: Markers up - Taxotere treatment. Mabledw luvtotravel

Posts.Content: Jan 17, 2009 04:10AM Mabledw wrote: Had my 2nd taxotere Wednesday.  I had the port in on Tuesday.  It was an ordeal as I bled terribly.  It worked Wednesday for the blood drawing and the therapy.  I am pretty miserable, however most of my misery is the terrible indigestion from the cancer being in my GI system. I can hardly eat anything - just very bland stuff.  Sometimes I am awake all night from just drinking water before I go to bed.  Onc said I should see some improvement soon.  I will have 4 treatments and then they will test my markers and he said we'll go from there.  Pray it will work and we'll see some improvements by the 4th treatment.  This sucks though.  Take care.  Mable.
Posts.Title: Markers up - Taxotere treatment. Mabledw luvtotravel

Posts.Content: Jan 7, 2008 01:07PM Mabledw wrote: Thanks everyone for your comments and suggestions.  I have had this diarrhea since the middle of Oct.  I have had a stool culture, nothing showed up.  I have been taking Questran (a cholesterol lowering drug that has side effects of constipation) it helps some when I stay on the rice-liquid diet.  If the colonoscopy doesn't show anything I will request seeing a digestive specialist. I too wonder about allergies. I know about the blood test that tests for 5 different things.  Wheat, corn, dairy, soy and I can't remember the other thing.  I have an older sister that developed food allergies when she was about my age. I guess we will just keep trying - one step at a time.  Thank you again for your comments and help.  Mable.
Posts.Title: CT scan results Mabledw riverinerabbit

Posts.Content: Jan 18, 2008 01:01PM Mabledw wrote: Thank you all for your words of encouragement.   I appreciate them so much - more than you know.  I think and pray for all of you.  Do take care.  Mable
Posts.Title: CT scan results Mabledw riverinerabbit

Posts.Content: Dec 5, 2008 07:16PM Mabledw wrote: Hi Everyone. I, too,  feel like I am going down hill.  It has been a long time since I posted anything.  These past 2 years have been a real roller coaster for me.  I have 3-4 months when I feel really good, so I try to get alot done.  But my cancer drugs go bad one me.  First I was on Femara, it lasted 7 months and I felt like I was run over by a truck, it was lots of pain.  My Onc took me off the Femara and gave me Faslodex shots.  In the mean time I was suffering with terrible back pain.  The cancer was in my bones including my lower back.  I had two herniated discs and had Steroid shots and treatments by chiropractor and physical therapy.  From all the drugs, I developed what is called Lymphocitic colitis,  It took 6 months to figure that out.  Terrible diahrea, I lost 12 pounds.  Anyway by the end of May I was feeling well, but my markers had started climbing.  In June I had a PET/CT scan and it didn't show any cancer significant enough to change my meds.  I stayed on Faslodex until November, when, because the numbers made some big jumps.  19 points in Oct.  So another PET/CT scan - but still no additional cancers.  The Onc changed my meds as he doesn't think the Faslodex is working anymore. I am now on Tamoxifen.   It this doesn't work, he said my next treatment would be Chemo.  He is giving me 2 months to see if the Tamoxifen changes my numbers.  In the meantime I have had a urinary infection and my potassium is so low I have to have a prescription for that.  I am on 9 prescriptions now.  It is awful.  I feel like I am falling apart.  One thing after another happens and I have some reactions to the meds.  I am extremely tired all the time and this past week I have been putting up with nausea.  I just don't get much done.  Lie in the recliner alot and doze for hours.   I think of whoever wrote "I wish I could go back 5 years"  I felt so alive and with energy, I was so busy with life, exercising, gardening, etc.  Now nothing.  I don't know if I will get my Christmas decorations up because of the nausea. I love Christmas, it is my favorite time of the year.  My daughter did my tree 2 years ago.  Last year it took me all month to get things up and then it was time to put them away.   I know you've heard enough from me, so for now I will sign off.  I want you to know I think of you all often and my prayers are with you.  Lynn, hang in there, I have and still plan to.  Its up hill sometimes and like I said a real roller coaster ride, but we can get through this.  Mable
Posts.Title: Feeling like I'm going down hill LynnW Mabledw

Posts.Content: Dec 9, 2008 03:51PM Mabledw wrote: Hi everyone!!! I am back- I mentioned that I have had terrible fatigue and nausea.  I went to Primary today.  They took blood tests to check my counts/platelets, etc.  Also on my last blood test at Oncologists it showed my sodium, chloride and potassium low.  They have put me on 40 mq of Potassium and a steriod to help bring the chloride up.  I will go back again Friday to have the potassium/sodium/chloride checked.  They also gave me a shot of Vitamin B12 to see if that would increase my energy.  We'll see.  Has anyone had these problems?  They thought I would be anemic because of the cancer in my bone marrow.  The dr also said the low potassium could be causing my nausea.   Gosh, I want to feel better before Christmas.  We want to go to our son's - 500 miles away to see our granddaughter perform with "Ballet West"s production of the Nutcracker.  She is 9 years old and has 2 parts. Pray for me.  Thanks, Mable
Posts.Title: Feeling like I'm going down hill LynnW Mabledw

Posts.Content: Dec 6, 2008 12:33PM Mabledw wrote: Dear LuAnn, Thanks for your reply.  I do have the pain under controll. Its just the nausea and the fatigue that I am battling right now.  I would like to know how you go about changing doctors and clinics.  I really like my Oncologist and the clinic I go to, but sometimes I wonder if a woman Oncologist would be better suited to my needs and understanding.  We live 50 miles from the largest town that has cancer clinics and I think there are 3, but I know the one I go to is the biggest and best known.  I don't know of anyone that goes to any of the other ones.  So no one to recommend anything to me.   Thanks for your comments and I to think of our similarities.  I was  ready to get off the Faslodex as I could tell it was giving me lots of side effects.  I sure wonder about the Tamaxifin though and told my Onc about my concerns.  He just said "This is a new day"  lets try it for now.   So what do you do?  Take care and thanks again.   Mable
Posts.Title: Feeling like I'm going down hill LynnW Mabledw

Posts.Content: Dec 29, 2008 12:43PM Mabledw wrote: Hi!!! well, we made it.  After more tests were done for thyroid and glucose, which were normal, it took me 3 days to recover.  I slept nearly all the time.  Recovered and did little bits each day.  We left for our sons on the 19th.  It took a few days to recover but just in time to see my granddaughter's performance.  She was wonderful to watch.  She had a little solo that brought down the house.  She was one of the baffoons. (clowns).  It was so cute.  We had a nice Christmas and I felt pretty good.  I found out that if I eat small amounts and not much sweets I don't have as much nausea.  The day before we left I had a sonogram of my pancreas, spleen, liver and kidney's.  Found out I have a cyst in my pancreas, this could cause some nausea.  I have dr appointments to find out what all needs done, if anything, about that and my next oncology on the 13th.  I still wonder if my markers are way up and that is causing the serious fatigue.  I still can't do much or I wind up in the recliner dozing all day.  If I do little bits at a time and nothing with any lifting or stairs, I can be up for quite awhile.  I wonder, too, about the tamoxifin's side effects.  Years ago when I took it I had side effects and had to go off it.  How long does it take for the tamoxifin to take effect?  I would really l ike to know.  Also, the past couple weeks I have developed weird pains in my palms and soles of feet that feel like a bee sting and then sometimes on other parts of my body it just feels itchy.   My hairline, eyebrows, inside my wrists and here and there. I haven't had allergies before so wonder about the tamoxifin.  Can anyone give me some advice.  I put medicated lotion and use lanocane. They help some.  Mable.
Posts.Title: Feeling like I'm going down hill LynnW Mabledw

Posts.Content: Apr 2, 2008 01:30PM - edited Apr 2, 2008 01:30PM by Mabledw I have been on Zometa and Femara starting Dec 06.  At first it was every month and then in June 2007 my Onc said we could go every other month with the Zometa and then in July I had a terrible reaction to the Femara and he put me on monthly injections of Faslodex.  I don't seem to have any side effects from the Zometa.  I did have to have a tooth pulled due to gum problem.  I was off the Zometa just one month and didn't have any problems.  I have a bridge in place of the tooth now.  My dentist confered with an oral surgeon.  My gums and jaw do not have any pain now.  At first I had alot of sensitivity to cold, juicy or acidy foods, but that is gone now too.  Good luck to all of you on Zometa.  I had wondered how long I would be on it too.  Just hadn't remembered to ask my Onc.  Sounds like several different opinions out there.  Take care.  Mable
Posts.Title: How long on Zometa riverinerabbit TingleToes

Posts.Content: Mabledw wrote: Hi everyone!!! Just want to report that Friday, Jan.4th, I got the results of the CT scan performed last Monday.  The oncologist was positive that my mets had gone to my liver and/or bowels as I have been having diarrhea since the middle of October and they have tried so many things. They did not find any cancer in my adominal area.  Yea!!!! I was so happy to hear that report.   I have been on rice/bananas/toast and clear liquids for nearly 2 weeks now as it had gotten so bad.  This menu has helped a great deal.  I did have an attack while I was at the Onc.  He became very aware of my condition.  He has ordered a colonoscopy for Tuesday as the next step.  I still think it is the Faslodex.  I have a pamphlet that I got a couple weeks after starting Faslodex.  In the side effects paragraph it lists diarrhea as the 4th thing on the list.  I have ask the onc if it could be the Faslodex and he always says -No!! it is not the medicine.  Has anyone had any experience with Faslodex giving them diarrhea?  I just have to find out what is bothering me, I just can't go on like this.   Any suggestions would be greatly appreciated.  I won't get my colonospy results until the 14th.  Onc is booked solid until then.  I think I am going to call and ask if he can't tell me on the phone as it is 50 miles to his office.  Hope you all are doing good.  Take care and hang in there (that's what I keep telling myself).  Mable Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: CT scan results Mabledw riverinerabbit

Posts.Content: Oct 21, 2007 08:24PM - edited Oct 21, 2007 08:26PM by Mabledw Hi everyone,  Well the past 2 weeks have been a whirlwind.  I have mentioned all the pain I have had due to the Femara.  My Onc took me off of it and said my pains should go away in 3-4 weeks.  Some did and some didn't.  I was put on 40 mg prednisone for 4 days and that really helped my joint pain, but still so much pain.  I called my ONc about RA tests and he said to see my Primary Care.  I did that and he immediately had me do an MRI to make sure there wasn't any more cancer or what.  THe MRI said cancer in lumbar 3 and degenerated disk in lumbar 4.  My ONc immediately set me up for full body bone scan.  That was Tues the 16th.  Both MRI and Scan were very painful as I couldn't lay flat. Lots of drugs to keep me sedated.  Also on the day of my MRI I saw my RA and she took blood tests, etc.  They came back - Lupus normal, RA some abnormalities of which she wasn't sure of.  She confered with my Onc and they determined a small amount of cancer in the pelvis area but the rest was herniated discs.  After the bone scan I saw my Onc and he said I had herniated discs in 3, 4 & 5 Lumbar and some problems in 1 & 2.  HE said I could go to my chripractor, but I am also on muscle relaxant and will see a pain management specialist to see about an uperderial. My pain has gotten so bad I can hardly walk 20 feet and then I am all bent over. I have been ice packing and immobile.  I just can't imagine how it all happened at once?  I can hardly wait to get rid of the pain.  The good news of course is there isn't any cancer in my bones except a small group in the pelvis area!!!! yea!!!. Mable
Posts.Title: Bone mets nursecal awjkej

Posts.Content: Nov 9, 2007 09:06PM Mabledw wrote: Hi all, Well it has been 2 weeks since I had my injections in my spine.  The Doctor gave me 2 shots.  It was horribly painfull to get them, but once it was over it was just dealing with the pain in my back and down my leg.  The next day, my pain was nearly gone.  I have been seeing the chiropractor twice a week and as of today, I am nearly pain free.  We just have to wait now to see if it stays that way.  Did I tell you the good news out of all this.  When I had the full body bone scan it showed only one spot of cancer left and my markers were down to 27.  Now, hopefully I will be back to my monthly visits, however I have been dealing with diarrhea for nearly a month.  My onc thought it might be just the pain medications, but I haven't taken anything (not even ibuprophen) since Oct. 31.  I live on the BRAT diet and have lost 6-8 lbs.  I just hope it isn't the Faslodex.  Has anyone had side effects like that from Faslodex?  The best to all of you. Mable.
Posts.Title: Bone mets nursecal awjkej

Posts.Content: Jan 10, 2008 01:15PM Mabledw wrote: I did get part of the results from my colonoscopy.  The Dr who did it came in right afterwards and told me and my husband.  He said he hadn't seen such a clean colon in a long time.  Nothing there to show the problem, however, he did take tissue samples and is sending them to the lab for analyzation.  I will get those results Monday.  I still think it is the Faslodex.  When I had my mastectomy in 1996 they put me on temoxafin.  After 7 months with diarrhea (it wasn't nearly as bad as this time and I could control it with Imodium) went  through similar tests, they took me off it and in just a short time my diahrrea was gone.  I do have low thyroid and take Synthroid daily.  I am looking forward to Monday and will tell my Onc (if nothing else shows up from tissue samples) that I will not take another dose of Faslodex and to find another drug.   My next dose is Jan 24th.   Thanks everyone for your comments.  Mable.
Posts.Title: CT scan results Mabledw riverinerabbit

Posts.Content: Jan 17, 2008 01:56PM Mabledw wrote: I saw my Onc on Monday.  HE said results of colonoscopy biopsy showed that I had colitis and diverticula.  He wanted me to go see the GI dr that did the Colonsocopy.  I saw him yesterday.  He said I had a lymphocylic colitis (microscopic colitis).  This is a rather unusual type of colitis and can only be detected by a tissue biopsy and viewed under a microscopic (thus the microscopic colitis).  I was certainly relieved that it was not cancer related.  It was probably caused by all the pain meds (ibuprofen, prednisone, steriods) that I took when I had the herniated discs in my back and the pain was so bad.  They can't pinpoint any causes for this disease, but said that pain meds may be the culprit.  It is incureable, like the metastic breast cancer, but treatable.  I am to stay on a bland diet, get lots of rest and take a prescription called Asacol.  I take 3 tablets with breakfast and 3 with dinner to start with.  After 3 weeks if it hasn't helped I am to increase it to 6 tablets twice a day.  What else can happen to me.  It just seems like I get one thing under control and something else happens.  I am glad it isn't the Faslodex. Thanks for your concern and comments.  I really appreciate this site and to read of everyone's experiences.  It really helps me.   Mable
Posts.Title: CT scan results Mabledw riverinerabbit

Posts.Content: Feb 23, 2009 12:08PM Mabledw wrote: I am back today.  Have had a rough week though.  Lots of down time.  Eating and drinking is a challenge as I am having lots of mouth issues.  My tongue is like it has been burned from drinking a hot liquid.  My knose continues to seep.  I have had PET/CT scans twice.  They do not show any tumors that is why the oncologist says my cancer has developed into a very sneaky situation.  I will ask more about the lobular testing.  Thanks everyone for your comments and support.  Mable.
Posts.Title: Mets to liver - now what Mabledw heatherpalmerton

Posts.Content: Dec 29, 2007 10:33AM Mabledw wrote: Happy New Year Everyone!! It's hard to believe 2008 is upon us.  Just want to thank all of you for  your comments.  They are so encouraging and educational.  I will report when I get the results of the CT next Friday.  Hope you all can enjoy a fun New Years Eve and the best New Year ever.  Mable
Posts.Title: Searching for more of us with liver and bone mets Joan_k Denny123

Posts.Content: Dec 28, 2007 11:51AM Mabledw wrote: Hi Everyone! You are all so special in your comments.  They are always encouraging and uplifting.  Now it's my turn to ask for prayers. I ws dx recurrent bc last Dec.  In my bones/bone marow. Took Femara for 7 months and had a reaction.  Then Faslodex since Aug. My markers had gone down every month.  Now I have been having terrible bouts of diahrrea for the past 10 weeks.  My Onc gave me a cholesterol lowering drug, it's side effect is constipation.  It worked, for about 3 weeks.  The past 2 weeks I have really been hit again.  Taking the drug plus Immodium several times a day.  Today I am on a liquid only diet.  Yesterday I saw the Onc and he thinks it is the cancer.  I will have a CT scan Monday, get the results Friday.  He thinks it is in my liver and/or my bowels.  Here I thought I was doing better as my bone scan in October showed the cancer was nearly gone from them.  My markers went up 9 points last month though.  I have decided this journey is going to be very hilly, with lots of ups and downs.  Don't know really what to expect if they find it in my liver or bowels.  Do they do Chemo and/or radiation when that happens.  You that have liver mets - what can you tell me?  I appreciate all your comments and support.  Mable.
Posts.Title: Searching for more of us with liver and bone mets Joan_k Denny123
